Description: Rectangular mudstone palette. Squared edges, shows slight wear.
Curator's comments: Brunton considered this palette as belonging to his Tasian culture, but it was the only one of the five he found that was made of mudstone (greywacke).
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (p. 7, 29-30; pl. xiii.25; xxii.17)
